globalblocking-block-reason-dropdown:
The choices that appear in the drop-down box, for the Global Blocking extension.
The top star is the unclicked list. The double-starred items are the reasons in the list.
For more information about Global Blocking, see https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Global_Blocking
globalblocking-block-expiry:
After the colon, the user can enter a timestamp on which the block automatically ends or a time period like "1 hour", "2 days", "1 year" etc. But in English only because the time period is parsed by the underlying OS, not by MediaWiki.
{{Identical|Expiry}}
globalblocking-ipbanononly:
Label for checkbox asking if the blocker wants to globally block anonymous users only. The checkbox is disabled if the target of the block is a username.
Similar to {{msg-mw|ipb-hardblock}}.
globalblocking-block-expiryinvalid: Used as error message on Special:GlobalBlock if expiry time entered was invalid.
globalblocking-block-failure:
Error message shown when the username, IP address, or IP range used as the target could not be blocked globally.
Parameters:
* $1 is the target (which can be a username, IP address, or IP range).
globalblocking-block-alreadyblocked:
Used as error message. Parameters:
* $1 - IP address
globalblocking-bigrange:
Used as error message to be shown when the user creating a global block tries to apply a IP address range block that exceeds the set limits.

Parameters:
* $1 - the IP address range
* $2 - the type of IP range (IPv4 or IPv6)
* $3 - the numeric value of the range limit
globalblocking-also-local-talk: Form label for a checkbox that when checked prevents the user from editing their talk page for the local block that is applied.
globalblocking-also-local-email: Form label for a checkbox asking if the blocker wants to block email on the local block (only applies if the user specifies that a local block should also be applied).
globalblocking-also-local-soft: Label for checkbox which if checked will make the local block only apply to anonymous users. This checkbox is disabled if the target of the block is a user.
globalblocking-list-intro: Appears on top of [[Special:Globalblocklist]] (part of [[mw:Extension:GlobalBlocking|Extension:GlobalBlocking]], which is not installed on translatewiki.net; example: [[wikipedia:Special:Globalblocklist]]).
globalblocking-list-ipinvalid:
Used as error message in Special:GlobalBlockList. Parameters:
* $1 - IP address

See also:
* {{msg-mw|globalblocking-list-target-invalid}}
globalblocking-search-errors:
Unused at this time.

Parameters:
* $1 - number of reasons
globalblocking-list-blockitem:
Parameters:
* $1 - a timestamp (time and date, localized)
* $2 - the blocking user
* $3 - the source wiki for the blocking user
* $4 - the blocked user
* $5 - the list of block options
globalblocking-list-whitelisted:
Used as a flag shown next to existing blocks on Special:GlobalBlockList. Indicates that the given block is locally disabled on the current wiki.
Parameters:
* $1 - The username of the user who disabled the block
* $2 - The reason provided for disabling the block
globalblocking-expiringblock:
Used as a flag shown next to blocks on Special:GlobalBlockList. Indicates when the given block expires.

Parameters:
* $1 - The date that the block expires
* $2 - The time that the block expires
See also:
* {{msg-mw|globalblocking-infiniteblock}} which is used if the block has no expiry (indefinite)
globalblocking-add-block: Link to Special:GlobalBlock. Shown on Special:GlobalBlock below the success message: {{msg-mw|globalblocking-block-success}}.
globalblocking-notblocked:
Used as error message in Special:GlobalBlockStatus and Special:RemoveGlobalBlock. Parameters:
* $1 - IP address

See also:
* {{msg-mw|globalblocking-notblocked-new}}
globalblocking-unblock-unblocked:
Used as success message in [[Special:GlobalUnblock]]. Parameters:
* $1 - IP address
globalblocking-whitelist-notapplied: Error message shown on Special:GlobalBlockWhitelist when global blocks are not applied on the wiki.
globalblocking-whitelist-statuslabel: Used as a checkbox label on Special:GlobalBlockWhitelist.
globalblocking-whitelist-whitelisted:
Used as success message in Special:GlobalBlockStatus. Parameters:
* $1 - IP address
* $2 - global block ID
globalblocking-whitelist-dewhitelisted:
Used as success message in Special:GlobalBlockStatus. Parameters:
* $1 - IP address
* $2 - global block ID
globalblocking-whitelist-nochange: Error message shown on Special:GlobalBlockWhitelist when no change has been made to the local status of the block.
globalblocking-whitelist-intro: Used as an introductory text on Special:GlobalWhitelist.
globalblocking-ipblocked:
A message shown to a [[mw:Extension:GlobalBlocking|globally blocked]] user trying to edit.

Refers to {{msg-mw|Emailuser}}.

This message is similar to a [[MediaWiki:Blockedtext|MediaWiki core message]].

Parameters:
* $1 - the username of the blocking user (steward), with a link
* $2 - the project name where the blocking user is registered (usually "meta.wikimedia.org" on Wikimedia servers)
* $3 - the reason specified by the blocking user
* $4 - a timestamp for when the block was set
* $5 - a timestamp for when the block will expire (or {{msg-mw|Infiniteblock}})
* $6 - the IP address of the globally blocked user (whose grammatical gender is unknown)

See also:
* {{msg-mw|globalblocking-ipblocked-range|notext=1}}
globalblocking-ipblocked-range:
A message shown to a user whose IP is in a [[mw:Extension:GlobalBlocking|globally blocked]] range trying to edit.

Refers to {{msg-mw|Emailuser}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - the username of the blocking user (steward), with a link
* $2 - the project name where the blocking user is registered (usually "meta.wikimedia.org" on Wikimedia servers)
* $3 - the reason specified by the blocking user
* $4 - a timestamp for when the block was set
* $5 - a timestamp for when the block will expire (or {{msg-mw|Infiniteblock}})
* $6 - the IP address of the globally blocked user
* $7 - the CIDR range that is blocked

See also:
* {{msg-mw|globalblocking-ipblocked|notext=1}}
globalblocking-ipblocked-xff:
A message shown to users who have one or more proxies in their XFF header who's IP are blocked.

Refers to {{msg-mw|Emailuser}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - username, no GENDER support
* $2 - wikiname
* $3 - reason
* $4 - start timestamp of block; localized timestamp
* $5 - expiry timestamp of block; localized timestamp or the message {{msg-mw|Infiniteblock}}
* $6 - IP address which is blocked
globalblocking-blocked-nopassreset: An error message shown when trying to reset password through [[Special:PasswordReset]] using a globally blocked IP address.
globalblocking-logpagetext: Shown as header of [[Special:Log/gblblock]] (part of [[mw:Extension:GlobalBlocking|Extension:GlobalBlocking]], which is not installed on translatewiki.net; example: [[wikipedia:Special:Log/gblblock]])
globalblocking-block-logentry:
Used as a log entry. Parameters:
* $1 - a link to a user page of the form User:Name
* $2 - an expiry time
globalblocking-block2-logentry:
Used as a log entry. Parameters:
* $1 - a link to a user page of the form User:Name
* $2 - a reason for the action
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Globalblocking-modify-logentry}}
globalblocking-unblock-logentry:
This message is a log entry. Parameters:
* $1 - contributions of an IP
For an example see [{{canonicalurl:meta:Special:Log/gblblock|uselang=en}} meta:Special:Log/gblblock?uselang=en]
globalblocking-modify-logentry:
Used as a log entry. Parameters:
* $1 - a link to a user page of the form User:Name
* $2 - a reason for the action
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Globalblocking-block2-logentry}}
globalblocking-loglink:
Shown at [[Special:BlockList]] when the GlobalBlocking extension is enabled (not on translatewiki).
* $1 is the requested IP address
